conclusion: Car A drives into the table from the right side where several scattered blocks and a marble are placed.
The image shows scattered blocks of different colors: orange stack, loose red cubes, yellow cubes, blue stack, and green stack. Car A is moving from the right side toward the blocks.
Car A is moving almost straight toward the orange stack that stands slightly forward of the loose red and yellow cubes.
The orange stack is the first obstacle in Car A's direct path; very little side-slip is visible, so no earlier contact with the scattered red cubes is expected.

On impact, the orange stack will tip and absorb most of Car A’s kinetic energy; the car will slow sharply, slide only a short additional distance, and come to rest immediately next to (or just touching) the toppled orange blocks.
None of the blue, green, or rear yellow blocks lie in the car’s line of travel, so they remain untouched.

Final answer: Car A will collide with the orange tower, the red, yellow, blue, and green blocks will not be hit, and the car will stop right beside the fallen orange blocks, a little to the left of its entry line.
